description: I have been working at Travelex full-time
pros: Easy job,  mostly great coworkers.
cons: Not an enjoyable work environment. Base pay hasn't changed in years, no real raises. No room for growth.
advice: Treat employees better.

description: I have been working at Travelex
pros:
Experience
Great colleagues
Good first job
Good training
Good environment
cons:
Benefits package has been incrementally cut evrry year for the last 3 years
Compensation is always on the low end in comparison to equivalent positions elsewhere. This used to be offset by the benefits, but as per my comment above, that is no longer the case
The bonuses keep getting smaller along with annual raises. 
Some management treats their staff like incompetant pack mules
advice:
Value your employees more and you will lose fewer good people. 
Listen to the advice of front line staff and you will make better business decisions

description: I worked at Travelex  for more than 5 years
pros: great colleagues to work with
cons: company don't value the staff that they have working for them and only care about figures and making as much money as possible. no bonus for front line staff, bonus for management
advice: care about staff and development that way you have less staff turnover and store closures

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for more than 3 years
pros:
Starting pay is decent, usually around $11 / hr (in California).
Good benefits.
cons:
Terrible rates on currency results in LOTS of angry customers who will take their wrath out on you.
Company tends to take away bonus structures.
Not much room to advance without relocating.
advice: Your employees deserve to make more money for how they get treated by rude customers

description: I worked at Travelex part-time for more than a year
pros:
Excellent line manager
Once trained, the job is quite simple so minimum stress.  
In- bureau culture was great.  Lovely work colleagues.  
Ability to work shifts to fit around studying.  
For a part-time student job, this was quite 'responsible' and looked great on a CV.  Much better than other minimum wage part time jobs available for students. 
If you are looking for somewhere to work whilst...
cons:
Very little career progression opportunities.  
Pay for full time was bad, plus if you were only part-time the bonus scheme worked against you.
Senior management were on occasion, hypercritical and unprofessional.
Job is very target driven and you will be named and shamed if you do not reach the required targets. 
Could be stressful when new in the job as you were left alone after not much training.  
Full...
advice: Make targets realistic to motivate employees and work to encourage people to stay longer.

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for more than 10 years
pros: -Company has values; its a company with good ethics
cons: Your life revolves around work. Feeling of over-worked.
advice: Invest in your staff. Its worth every penny

description: I worked at Travelex
pros:
- Laxed culture 
- Training was good but not excellent
- Commission bonus capped at 1250 but easy to hit
cons:
- unstable management team
- archaic IT system
advice: To talk to higher management to increase IT structure and infrastructure.

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for more than a year
pros: There was a lot of downtime where i focused on studying and furthering my career.  You can learn all about Forex and currency trading markets.
cons: not much room for growth within the company
advice: Be fair, and be nice to everyone.

description: I worked at Travelex
pros:
You can hear about places people travel - get advice on traveling
Staying informed on currency rates
Discount on exchange
Opportunity for bonus based on sales
Training on currency security/anti-money laundering
cons:
Compensation is low
Bonuses are low in slow travel times
Minimal time off
Redundant sales practices - same product/sales pitch over and over
advice:
Better compensation for higher sales numbers
Hire managers that have sales experience and not just administrative or supervisory experience

description: I have been working at Travelex full-time for more than 3 years
pros:
Perfect for students as scheduling are very flexible.
Provides various incentives plans for bonus opportunity.
Able to meet and interact with various people from all over the world.
cons:
Lack of career / opportunity growth.
One-man shifts and therefore causes problem with work-life balance.
Long and boring when there are no customers.
advice: Provide opportunity for growth internally within the company. Communication improvement with employees and peers from various departments. Better turn-around response from any technical issues.

description: I have been working at Travelex
pros: None that I can think of.
cons: Very disorganized.  Management only care about themselves.
advice: Hire managers that care about their employees.

description: I worked at Travelex
pros: Learn about World Trade and Finance.
cons: Airport security is a hassle to get through everyday, low pay, horrible hours, no opportunity to move up in the company, feel like you are trapped in a dead end job.
advice: Do better.

description: I worked at Travelex
pros: I enjoyed the social aspect , speaking to customers ,  and also I loved learning about currencies and countries
cons: Very demanding targets for a wage that doesnt reflect this demand , I worked for 4 years and I had only 1 bonus,  despite being ahead for the majority of the time , as bonus was based on bureau as a whole not individuals.
advice: Please try to be more sympathetic  towards the little people , the ones who keep this company operating for the 7 days a week we do !!! And remember we are only human and mistakes happen ,  the reprimands for mistakes made far outweigh the actual mistake,  bonus' need to be for an individual not a combination of the bureau staff ,  breaks need to be made more a part of the day instead of us trying to grab 10 mins...

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for less than a year
pros: Sold to you very well in the interview, about being fexible by working 4 on 4 off, very different when your actually in the job.
cons: Good mix of customers, alot just very happy to collect there money that they got a better rate for.
advice: Sort out the management through the branch.

description: I have been working at Travelex part-time for more than a year
pros: Easiest job ever, just sitting down until a customer approaches you.
cons: No hours if you're a part time. Company only looks over themselves they don't care about their employees. Unprofessional management along with regional manager. Rates are horrible rarely anyone is willing to exchange with you because now and days people are getting smarter and know they are getting ripped off.
advice: Actually pay attention to your employees, give reasonable targets.

description: I have been working at Travelex
pros: ? Are there any?  Unable to provide any unfortunately......... Growing so possibly change and evolving into better company if better leadership
cons: Slow and bureaucratic.  Real need to to review structure and think of hiring in skills at leadership level as company too closed
advice: Hire better management

description: I have been working at Travelex part-time for more than a year
pros: Nothing to difficult to deal with day to day. Talking to happy customers who are going on holiday, helping people have a nicer experience
cons: Sitting for hours with nothing to do on your own in a small space
advice: Review TMA Position in Retail and how people are trained for the position.

description: I have been working at Travelex full-time for more than 3 years
pros: Great staff to work with, work independantly, nearly as if you are your own boss, very flexible work hours
cons:
Salary is very demotivating. Near enough National Minimum Wage. No real benefits or perks apart from this.
Senior management not so helpful. No career progression opportunities.
advice: Consider salary or more benefit perks that would be beneficial to staff. Help staff progress.

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for more than a year
pros: lots of overtime, monthly bonuses when goal is made
cons: can take up a lot of personal time, management had a lot of last minute communications, you might be required to work long shifts alone at a store while being told they will hire someone,
advice: more communication, more pay for the responisbilty gived

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for more than 3 years
pros: Promotions and bonus opportunity, always a leader in the industry.
cons: Lack of vision, when it comes to marketing and product.
advice: Good work life balance.

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for less than a year
pros: The money, when they actually pay you it
cons: The management themselves don't seem to care much for the lower colleagues, if they have a problem they normally dismiss it but as soon as you make the smallest mistake they are on your case like you've just committed a murder. Poor communication within the company. I got my first pay 2 weeks late and my last pay was underpaid by £200 and after 4 weeks I still have no information as to why I've been underpaid. The...
advice: Treat your staff with respect as they are the ones who give you the money you earn. Maybe even give them 1% of their earnings in a year, I mean £1000 to the £100,000 they made for you is nothing really is it?

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for more than a year
pros: I worked at a mall kiosk for Travelex. Pretty easy day. Sales targets can be easy to meet if you try.
cons: Boring. Working in a mall can get frustrating, since there are no amenities to the booth.
advice: Offer higher wages.

description: I have been working at Travelex full-time for more than 5 years
pros: You have to learn new skills quickly and react and adapt quickly to change which for personal development is very good.
cons: Long term employment or hard work is not rewarded or recognised, Inadequate training given, Lack of management and head office support, stressful environment due to amount of work and responsibility with a small wage budget. Low pay especially for responsibly. Extremely small environment to work in.
advice: Remember your supposed company values and look after and reward those who work so hard for you! Be more organized and give adequate training and supportive tools to support colleague's through change. Listen to your staff and value their opinion and act upon it to create a better work environment.

description: I have been working at Travelex part-time for more than a year
pros: ITS A GREAT PART TIME JOB TO SUPPLEMENT INCOME. They are flexible if you attend school or have another job.  A lot of overtime if you need it.
cons: Unrealistic goal expectations. Low wages.  Has a very high overturn of staff and management.
advice: Increase wages and incentives to keep quality staff.

description: I worked at Travelex part-time for more than 3 years
pros: Really enjoyed the job as travel money manger for 3 years until I was ill and was penalised for it!  It did take over my life though as when ever anyone rang in sick it was my responsiblity to cover the bureau myself if I couldn't get any cover, meaning I would have to cancel plans.
cons: I got a new regional manager whilst I was ill, and he was not sympathetic to the time I had off due to illness.  He wanted to discipline me for my absence level even though it was work related and previous to this illness I had not had a single day off sick in over 3 years!  I put in a grievance about my regional manager that kept being rescheduled, and it eventually was heard after I had made the decision to leave...
advice: Employ decent people as regional mangers and value your staff more.

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for more than a year
pros: apparently most good people are employed by travelex
cons: higher management is not worthy, too much to do for too less in return
advice: Start looking after your staff who looks after your customers and your bank balances

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for more than a year
pros:
Excellent team to work with
Simple job
Good flexible hours
cons:
Incompetent regional manager
Managers try to bully employees into doing shifts and duties beyond what they were hired for
advice:
Get a clue! 
Value your employees

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for more than a year
pros: Lots of overtime (extra cash), Nice colleagues (if your lucky), build a good knowledge of currency and destinations, good sales experience, at store manager level the flexibility to run the store pretty much as your own very little on hand management in terms of no one watching over your shoulder.
cons:
very much takes over your life as you are expected to work overtime (not really a choice more an obligation) at very short notice sometimes having to travel up to 2 hours away using own transport( you do get paid mileage) i have and know of many others who work 7 days a week sometimes only having 1 day off a months ( these are normally 12 hour days as well), 

Some staff can be very bitchy and have been known to...
advice:
cape hours people are allowed to work, higher pay for the stress and risk involved, more achievable bonuses that are set per person not as a team as you cannot judge someone who works 40+ hours a week the same as someone who works 10 and doesn't care about the business. 

more support for staff regional management shoudl visit each store at least once a week to check how staff are and if there are any issues...

description: I have been working at Travelex part-time for less than a year
pros: Its a job, not much else.
cons: The Management, the lack of respect for lower employees, minimum wage, the amount of stress when no one else pulls there weight, the staff turnover rate is appalling, the rota is always the worst shifts imaginable, and you get no thanks for anything, no opportunities to progress.
advice: Pay attention to the people who actually run the bureaus.

description: I worked at Travelex part-time for less than a year
pros: I can't think of any positives I got from this job
cons: Worked there for a few months and never experienced such a bad working environment. Working in target pressured environment for very little money. My team leader was never concerned with any problems unless brought up my senior management!! Never actually met any of senior management only dealt with them through the phone. HR was one of the poorest I've ever experienced!! Could only contact through email and when...
advice: Actually visit the bureau's once in a while and possibly treat the staff a lot better

description: I worked at Travelex part-time for more than 3 years
pros: Meeting new people, developing new skills, learning a new trade, career development, being the face of one of the leading companies in the world. Excellent rates on foreign currency. Chance of career progression.
cons: Lack of support from upper management, unrealistic expectations from upper management in terms of role responsibility and staffing management.
advice: Have clear procedures in place for staff management in the event of sickness etc. It is unrealistic to expect other staff members to pick up the slack indefinitely. Provide more support and contsructive criticism if targets are not being met. Negative attitudes and beratement are not conducive for staff morale.

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for more than 3 years
pros: The fellow staff members and location manager Kamlesh Patel. Majority of them were very nice to work with.
cons:
Some of the duties (off the top of my head):
customer service
sales
admin
cleaning duties
transferring large amounts of money putting ones own life at risk
operating various computer programs
handling various account holders
looking out for anti money laundering
operating and balancing the till
managing a bureau de change sometimes by yourself 
working long hours (10 to 12 hour shifts)
ordering...
advice: Congrats! You're the epitome of Capitalism! Thats not a compliment

description: I have been working at Travelex full-time for more than a year
pros: Unfortunately there are no Pros to list, this company doesn't even deserve one star.
cons: This is the most unorganized and unprofessional environment I have ever experienced. No one in the company can answer questions for you, there is no training, and nothing to look forward to. 'I don't know' is the most common answer to questions.
advice: Hire a new HR manager/staff for North America. I have never worked for a company with such a cold, unfriendly, and unenthusiastic HR team.

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for more than 3 years
pros: Fun environment at first, family-like colleagues. Enjoyable role with good customer interactions. Interesting to interact and communicate with different people every day.
cons: Very stressful and physically draining during busy periods. No opportunity to develop or grow within the company. No benefits or incentives with regards to performance. Very little appreciation or recognition from management.
advice: Should be more promotion from within the company rather than employing from elsewhere. More recognition of outstanding performance.

description: I have been working at Travelex full-time for more than a year
pros:
Reasonable exposure to retail financial services and you'll get a well known company on your CV. Can be a useful stepping stone into better places to work.

It is possible to work from home. 

Some very good colleagues.
cons:
Poor systems, poor upper management with little or no understanding about the nature of the business who therefore struggle to provide adequate guidance to other team members. 

Sales targets are unrealistic and effectively demoralise colleagues as they are unattainable. 

Salaries are on or below the minimum you would expect to be paid. Benefits are terrible. 

Pressurised to work substantial additional hours...
advice:
Pay your staff properly and adequately resource your departments. 

Try and make your upper management more visible to the rank and file.

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for more than 3 years
pros: Got in contact with many people who I helped very good
cons:
•	I have trained, coordinated and inspired employees to do a better job in a shorter amount of time, thereby expanding the reputation and income of our organization.
•	Revitalized communication between upper and middle management.
•	Studied the company’s vision statement so I was better prepared to carry it out in my  daily tasks.
•	Took a communications class on my own to improve my my skills with coworkers and...
advice: No advice because everything was good organized and they tread there employers very good

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for more than a year
role: Former Employee - Sales and Relationship Manager
pros: It is a well established MNC with offices around world
cons: There are no guidance provided my the management
advice: Please provide more support to your staff especially those newly hired

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for more than 10 years
pros: departmental staff and  teamwork management  good
cons: to interested in saving money to make company attractive for what would seem to be an obvious floatation
advice: listen to your staff instead of pretending to

description: I have been working at Travelex full-time for more than a year
pros: Not much, older culture on the Global Business Side and people were extremely reserved.  No one to really train, or help you.
cons:
Poor training
Smile and dial
Most of the firms they asked you to follow up with were poorly selected
advice: Better training, data mining.

description: I have been working at Travelex full-time for more than 5 years
pros: The temperature rarely gets below -1 C indoors in the winter and you get free parking and uniform. I honestly can't think of any more than that.
cons: It's a pushy cutthroat sales environment, where you are under constant pressure to sell people things they didn't ask for.  There are effectively no performance related bonuses, as the targets are always geared to save the company costs on paying out. They also cut costs by withholding pay rises from all but the most ruthless sales staff who, to achieve their targets, have to be overly pushy or risk being seen as a...
advice:
Look very carefully at the regional/middle managers, stop promoting ruthless sociopaths at this level (that's not aimed at Jackie M. - she's a rare gem).  Investigate the use of veiled threats, insults, psychological cruelty, bullying, and fear by middle managers - if i wanted to join the Church of Scientology i would have done so by now.  

Uphold the very values you are so keen for front line staff to uphold....

description: I worked at Travelex full-time
pros: None, I can't think of one positive thing to say about this company!
cons: If you are looking to work for a disorganized company you found it!
advice: Replace ALL current management and create a business plan (and stick with it) for the markets sold into.

description: I have been working at Travelex full-time for more than 10 years
pros: Job security. People are always traveling, collecting and trading so If you do well, you will always be on the team. Great Benefits.
cons: Most promotions are done from the outside
advice: Hire from

description: I have been working at Travelex part-time
pros: Colleagues at other stores and regional management are friendly and willing to help; this is crucial considering the amount of time you will spend on the phone to them.
cons: Working hours are not regular and make it difficult to plan anything outside of work; work-life balance is poor. The hours of work are draining, with ten hour shifts on Saturdays being common, as well as late day ends followed by early starts the next day. Contracted hours are more of a minimum number of hours worked in a week; it is not unusual to find yourself working five or ten hours longer than you are...
advice:
Better manage workload and working hours, and do more to help employees attain a good work-life balance.

Fully train staff rather than leaving them to train themselves on the job.

Pay staff adequately in relation to what their work entails.

description: I worked at Travelex full-time
pros:
6% match on 401K contributions.

A place to build experience.

I have a 20 word minimum I must fulfill, but I have nothing else nice to say.
cons:
Everything else, including:

Low pay.

Lack of trust between different business groups.

Non-functioning IT support.

Dishonesty in communication from executive board on down.

Unhelpful human resources.

Global leadership lives in a bubble in London.
advice: Sell the company to a group that's competent.

description: I have been working at Travelex full-time for more than a year
pros: Knowledge of foreign currency and skills in customer service.
cons: Low pay, long lifeless hours,terrible work/life balance, management seem clueless at times,Poor working conditions, Abused by customers about there shoddy products, no appreciation of the workforce unless you sell products (which is not suitable at times and demographics contribute to low sales), trades far below competitors rates,no staff retention, no ability to progress, expect you to work for free at times...
advice: Pay the extra fee when doing background checks to clear staff, rather than waiting for months to employee new starters opposed to paying hotel and mileage costs. This would work out cheaper in the long run. Value your employees more.

description: I have been working at Travelex
pros:
- great team leaders and work colleagues
- team leaders will actually want you to progress instead of staying at your current level just to meet the staff count
-commission wasn't bad
cons: none that i can think of
advice: keep it up... encourage more people to have goals and ambitions and progress- that's when you'll the most out of your employees

description: I have been working at Travelex part-time for more than a year
pros: Great for resume if you want to transition to another cash handling job
cons: boring, boring, very boring, very very boring
advice: none

description: I worked at Travelex part-time for more than a year
pros: Cannot really think of any, experience in Foreign Exchange is the only Pro I can think of.
cons:
Poor pay with no chance of a payrise, unrealistic targets set to gain a payrise, with various reasons all the time given to not have one, it also falls largely down to your Team Leaders personal preference!

Health and Safety not adhered to, poor setup, freezing cold, dangerous boxes around, dangerous broken chairs, bad setup of system, printers that shock you when you try and make them work due to faulty leads,...
advice: Better consistant ongoing training, pay that reflects what you want from the employees, better working conditions that meet legal requirements, along with legal breaks (UK)

description: I have been working at Travelex part-time for more than a year
pros: Hard to think of any.
cons: Very little training - given access to manual to mainly teach yourself - whilst serving.  Little back-up, mainly relying on nearby stores for advice.   Hugh pressure to sell with unrealistic targets, targets that must be met to have any chance of a pay-rise. Rotas constantly changed with very little say - mainly due to staff leaving or just walking off.
advice: Employ more staff.  Give proper training - not just whilst serving.  Give proper and easy back-up support during whole of opening hours.  PAY STAFF FOR A SMALL PERIOD BEFORE AND AFTER OPENING HOURS, do not just presume that your staff will work for free in order to open bureau and to do the considerable shut down process!! (They won't!).  Also if changing staff over during day allow for a paid cross over period. ...

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for more than 3 years
pros: great working environment and a good place to start off at, easy to get a job there and esay work
cons: no where to move unless your a dinosaur, worse than below market pay management change high inertia to anything that isn't their idea
advice: pay your valued employees more

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for more than 3 years
pros:
Interesting projects.
Good work/life balance.
I had a great team and fairly decent managers.
cons:
All decision making comes from the HQ in the UK, so getting something done in the Toronto office can be rather challenging.
Career opportunities in the Toronto office are very limited.
Overall fairly low salary brackets.
I saw 3 CEOs over the course of 4 years, but with Peter Jackson staying more or less permanently, should be better now.
IT strategy focusing on using vendors rather than in-house teams, produces...
advice: Spend more time on the overall strategy. Treat in-house teams as valuable assets not just "cost of doing business" they will be a lot more productive.

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for more than 3 years
pros: Decent base compensation package, benefits are OK but not great
cons: Extremely disloyal and distrustful leadership in this organization.  Often felt as though they were playing a "shell game" with commissions and incentives - far too cleverly-worded outlines for commission/bonus schemes intended to mislead and truly baffle the honest earner.  Felt as though they always had their hands in my pockets when I wasn't looking.
advice: Really enforce your corporate code and live by the letter of that code.  Way, way too much deception going on at the branch and HQ levels.  Dorfman is an awesome self-made man and a true pleasure to meet, but the kid you have as CEO now couldn't be further from the mark you're trying to hit.

description: I have been working at Travelex part-time for less than a year
pros:
Working at Sydney international airport as a foreign exchange consultant was a great experience. You were given over $100K in money as well as crucial exposure to KPI's and being very detail orientated. The remuneration is also very attractive.

Great people and good learning environment. Perfect for any university student.
cons: The job has 2 permanent sets of hours 4.45am-12.45pm or 12.45pm-8.45pm. Both aren't particularly good, but as I said before. If you need solid work XP than this is the place.

description: I have been working at Travelex part-time for less than a year
pros: Interesting work, it is different everyday
cons: No benefits, no benefits, no benefits
advice: How about some benefits or incentive to stay here. I'm sure turnover is high.

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for more than a year
pros: Most of the people are nice to get along with
cons: It is full of testosterone and men think the women who work there are some sort of objects there for perving over it is amazing that the FD has managed to avoid a sexual harassment suit. They like to keep staff temporary for a VERY long time and the pay and prospects are dismal.
advice: To actually respect their staff and give them incentive to work

description: I worked at Travelex part-time for more than a year
pros: has a worldwide international brand name
cons: Not much room to move up in Melbourne
advice: more development for people and culture would be nice

description: I have been working at Travelex part-time for more than a year
pros:
-Looks better on Resume than job actually is
-Get free Certficate III in financial Services
-Opportunity to grow
cons:
-Poor communication from Management
-Lonely work as most branches are single employee
-Lots of Compliance
advice: Improvement of communication

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for more than a year
pros: You learn the most basic stuff of how to trade all currencies, market fluctuations, gold prices, what percentage CC companies take when you use your CC abroad and much more.
cons:
HQs are either in London, Canada or NYC. I was always confused which department was were. 
There was not a well-designed Training Program for new hires, all would depend on what you learned from former co-workers.
advice: Test all new hires in basic math, how to calculate a percentage for example.

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for more than 8 years
pros: Working as part of a team
cons: low salaries and working conditions need to be improved
advice: See all your staff as individuals

description: I have been working at Travelex part-time for more than a year
pros:
Good for the beginners.
Worthy job experience to apply for any other financial institutes.
Friendly co workers.
Parental leave allowence is available for casual employees.
cons:
Sometimes you have to do jobs that was not described in your contract.
You get extra 'ciggie break' if you are in supervisor's good book.
Almost impossible to have extra toilet break, because cannot leave the store on its own or no one is available to cover the store.
You cannot finish on time always because of workload.
advice: Look after your lower level management.

description: I have been working at Travelex full-time for less than a year
pros:
Diversity
Meeting new people & cultures
cons:
Lengthy shift timings
Stressful
Loads of paper work
advice: Useless paperwork should be eliminated.

description: I have been working at Travelex part-time for more than 3 years
pros: Flexible hours. Benefits are offered. Store location. You may come across some celebs and really interesting people. My team was very easy-going.
cons:
Low pay.
Low morale.
Benefits are too expensive based on hourly salary.
Foreign currency business is not long-term enough.
Sales goals are almost unreasonable
No real direction from upper management
advice:
Better training and development.
Re-evaluate incentives.

description: I have been working at Travelex
pros: Dealing with the challenges that constant change entails.  High degree of autonomy with a "hands-off" management approach.  Benefit package is competitive at a middle management level and above.
cons: Change is constant but can be very badly management with a high reliance on external consultant resource which has created communication problems.  Chances for development are limited, promotions seems to be haphazard affair.  Organisational structure is confusing and top heavy
advice: A more proactive approach to change management especially communications.  Project methodology needs to be applied across the board and adhered to.  Sort out the organisational structure - it's top heavy and many people add little value.

description: I have been working at Travelex
pros:
Friendly co-employees
A nice variety of customers to mingle with
Friendly hr department
interacting with different cultures around the world.
cons:
Poor management
poor training
draining (shift work) hours
very poor pay 
lack of management support
no praise for accomplishments
falsely given hope about opportunities within the company
undervalued employees
forced to do jobs outside your 'job description'
unrealistic targets
advice:
Value your employees more
Evaluate the people in management
hire someone with a bussiness qualification
increase the salary... especially the high performers
promote internal employees
don't lie

description: I worked at Travelex
pros:
Compared to other retasil jobs, this is more comfortable as there is no requirement to stand up for long periods.

The job of changing money is relatively easy.
cons:
Huge amounts of pressure from management to sell various products to customers, most of whom do not want to purchase these products. This leads to a situation where counter staff are pressured into annoying customers as they push for sales.

Pay is relatively low compared to a standard office job, and bonuses are practically non-existant, yet the mount of money an individual can make the company in one days work...
advice:
Fairer renumeration or adequate bonus for staff would ensure greater job satisfaction rather than the feeling of being taken advantage of.

More importance on the welfare of staff, and less emphasis on sales of products and performance figures that encourage staff to turn away business that would negatively impact on their averages.

description: I have been working at Travelex
pros: exposure to Foreign exchange business and good IT management
cons: RBusiness very unstructured due to global expansion
advice: N/a

description: I have been working at Travelex
pros: Very easygoing job. The benefits are great. They even help you pay for college. They pay 100 percent if the field you are studing is directly related to Travelex.
cons: High demands. The Sales Consultant title is tested when you find yourself doing management duties, but it does make you feel proud of the things you are doing.
advice: I would advice them to try to promote more within. I have been working really hard for a position that is still to become open. I hope when it does I am offered the chance to take it dead on. I know I would be perfect for the job.

description: I have been working at Travelex
pros:
1. The benefits package (health, time off, etc.) is acceptable
2. Central location is accessible to all in city
3. Co workers are nice people to work with
4. Physical location is very modern
cons:
1. Management CAN NOT be trusted! Will deceive to protect their you-know-what.
2. Salaries are way below industry standard and commission compensation is defined in a deceptive and complex manner
3. Career advancement is almost non-existent!
4. Company has identity crisis and cannot decide what it wants to be: An international bulk payments provider or an international foreign exchange provider. 
5. New product...
advice:
1. Decide on what the company identity is going forward
2. Take a cue from the industry standard regarding salaries to attract better talent
3. Create opportunities for advancement within - eg. more defined hierarchies within would help
4. Create environment of trust by following through on promises.
5. Provide strong leadership to carry out the preceding suggestions.

description: I worked at Travelex
pros:
Great co-workers
Able to accumulate vacation time.
cons:
fractured deparments
zero growth opportunities
managers lacked knowledge of basic processes within companies
Senior executives all British; were very condescending to those in the Australian, Canadian and American offices
advice: consolidate one central North American office!

description: I worked at Travelex
pros:
Good location in DC near 2 metro stops
Free gym in the building
cons:
Extremely underpaid compared to other companies 
Under average benefits compared to other companies 
Misleading growth opportunities
Low employee morale and high turnovers
An environment of "burn-outs" due to high workloads, lack of appropriate prioritization, internal politics, and lack of employee engagement/motivation
Leaders are not authentic, they don't engender trust
Poor leadership behavior is never...
advice:
Pay employees more money and offer better benefits
Hire competent managers
Buy Herman Miller chairs
Keep promises you make
Value your employees better, take care of them better (not just upper management) and see what happens

description: I have been working at Travelex
pros:
easy to get time off
flexible work hours
downtown DC
Gym in the building
coffee maker (although the coffee tastes awful)
cons:
compensation
HR department sides with Management
Managers who are in their position due to friends and family
biases that carry over between departments regardless of ones work ethic.
advice: Try and retain your top talent by paying them a competitive wage and get rid of some of the people who are barely competent enough to correctly complete their day to day responsibilities. This would help morale and show others that you respect and admire hard-work.

description: I worked at Travelex
pros: Decent hours, benefits, and working conditions ... nothing to write home about ... just bog standard
cons:
Big shakeups while I was there
Very heavy process involved for everything
Absentee senior management
advice: Pay more attention to management's results, rather than politics ...

description: I worked at Travelex
pros: The new team that was hired while I was  there was a good group of people- atmosphere was great.
cons: Zero guidence- management NEVER followed through with initiatives- the direct management spent most the time traveling between offices with no clear objective as to why they were even there
advice: Start over- treat the reps as profesionals vs you "play things" - you need to follow through on what you say your going to do rather than go in auto-pilot mode.

description: I have been working at Travelex
pros: Pay is good, very friendly enviroment
cons: No one wants to switch withnyou when u need a day off, sometimes its hard to get a day off even when you request it to the manager
advice: Not likely... Best place for college students or people who are looking for some type of income while they figure out things in their life

description: I worked at Travelex
pros: Compensation was average. But employees beware.  They hired 52 of us and laid off 50 of us at one time.  They have a reputation of doing this.
cons:
They have a reputation of doing this.  Products are hard to sell.  They worry too much about salesforece.com rather than results.
Manangement is poor we comes to supervising employees. They are constantly changing they way in which they operate. Alot of confusion.  They make promises on spiffs vs. commisions and never follow through.
advice: Get a clear and concise plan and stick to it.  Manangement is poor.

description: I have been working at Travelex
pros: competitive benefits, management is putting more effort into making a better work environment.
cons: no clear direction/management. Penny wise and pound foolish. There's internal struggles between departments (have a cover your ass mentality). The company seems to prefer hiring outside the company instead of promoting/rewarding their good employees.
advice: Improve the office culture and communicate the direction of the business to the whole company.

description: I have been working at Travelex full-time for more than a year
pros: aucun aucun aucun aucun aucun
cons: travailler a travelex en soit est un inconvenients
advice: treat us like humans

description: I have been working at Travelex full-time for less than a year
role: Current Employee - Gerente de câmbio pleno
pros: Empresa amigável, pessoas coloborativas e engajadas.
cons: Backoffice e processos operacaionais ruins.
advice: Investir em capacitação.

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for less than a year
pros: Beneficios de Bancário, Prédio Bonito, cafés diferenciados para os funcionários de graça
cons: Falta comunicação com as pessoas ao redor. Processos muito novos ainda a serem definidos
advice: Melhorar a comunicação e corroborar para um time mais colaborativo, que se importe com o coletivo para orientar o sucesso da empresa.

description: I worked at Travelex full-time
pros: Gezellige collega's, Veel kansen om jezelf te ontwikkelen in je functie en prettige werksfeer
cons: Salaris, weinig doorgroeimogelijkheden en vele reorganisaties
advice: Wees creatief kom met nieuwe producten. Probeer resultaten te bereiken met geldverslindende projecten en probeer kennis binnenboord te houden.

description: I worked at Travelex
pros: Sterk in extra legalevoorwaarden, bonussen, soort job. Veel gebruik van verschillende talen  en culturen.  Afwisselende job
cons: Verloning aan de lage kant, geen al te grote collegialiteit. Moederbedrif blijft bovenhand houden. Teveel bemoeienissenvan hen
advice: Doe meer an people management. Luister enwerk meer met collega's. Geef loon naar prestatie
